vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application has an XSS vulnerability in the xss23 endpoint where user input is insufficiently filtered and directly inserted into the HTML response

semantic_details.description: The application uses a regex filter that only removes tags except for <style> tags, allowing attackers to inject malicious style tags with JavaScript execution capabilities
scenario: Attacker provides input containing malicious <style> tags with JavaScript
The regex filter allows <style> tags to pass through
The input is directly inserted into the HTML response
When the victim views the page, the malicious JavaScript executes in their browser

vulnerabilities.vuln_name: Insecure File Operations in check_xss function
vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application creates temporary HTML files with predictable names in a publicly accessible directory

semantic_details.description: The application creates temporary HTML files in a static directory that is publicly accessible, with insufficient access controls and cleanup mechanisms
scenario: Application creates temporary HTML files in a static directory
Files may be accessible to other users before deletion
Race condition could allow access to files before they're deleted
Attacker could potentially access sensitive information in these files

vulnerabilities.description_of_vuln: The application uses PhantomJS to execute user-provided content without adequate security controls

semantic_details.description: The application uses PhantomJS to execute and validate user content, which can lead to server-side JavaScript execution vulnerabilities
scenario: Attacker provides specially crafted input that exploits PhantomJS vulnerabilities
The input is saved to a temporary file and executed by PhantomJS
Malicious code executes in the PhantomJS environment with application privileges
